description: Growing freight forwarding company is looking for an Ocean Import Coordinator for their office in LA, CA. You will work with a great team and have an excellent opportunity to grow within the company. This is a full-time position (not remote).
responsibilities: Team Management: Assist the Operation Manager in day-to-day Logistics operations. Shipment Coordination: Coordinate and manage the end-to-end logistics process for shipments. Documentation Management: Ensure that all required shipping documentation, including arrival notices and bills of lading are accurate, complete, and submitted on time. Freight Release: Ensure payment and bill of lading received and coordinate freight release with freight cashier. Cargo Tracking: Monitor and track shipments in real-time to ensure timely movement, delivery, and empty return. Customer Communication: Provide regular updates to customers on the status of their shipments and address any inquiries or concerns promptly and professionally. Vendor Communication: Coordinate with carriers, truckers, origin agents, and other relevant stakeholders to ensure timely and accurate information exchange throughout the import process. Invoicing: Generate and issue invoices to customers. Perform other tasks that contribute to the overall goals of the company.

qualifications.required: 2+ years’ experience in Ocean Import freight with an NVOCC/Freight Forwarder is required. Legal US working status. Excellent written and verbal knowledge in English. Must be proficient in Microsoft office (Excel, Outlook).
qualifications.preferred: Ability to speak/read Mandarin would be required.
